body_html: The tf.contrib.ffmpeg ops aren't currently supported on Windows. As far as I remember, they rely on some POSIX-specific code for running a subprocess that would need to be ported to using CreateProcess(). I've assigned @fredbertsch, who's the owner of that code, to comment on the chances of this being supported on Windows in the future.
body_text: The tf.contrib.ffmpeg ops aren't currently supported on Windows. As far as I remember, they rely on some POSIX-specific code for running a subprocess that would need to be ported to using CreateProcess(). I've assigned @fredbertsch, who's the owner of that code, to comment on the chances of this being supported on Windows in the future.
body: The `tf.contrib.ffmpeg` ops aren't currently supported on Windows. As far as I remember, they rely on some POSIX-specific code for running a subprocess that would need to be ported to using `CreateProcess()`. I've assigned @fredbertsch, who's the owner of that code, to comment on the chances of this being supported on Windows in the future.
